ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.2_0: King Pasenadi of Kosala told his park-keeper, “Go and clean up the park;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.3_0: “Yes, sir.” While cleaning the park, he saw the Buddha seated at the foot of a tree.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.4_0: Having seen (that), he went to the Kosalan King Pasenadi,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.4_1: and after approaching he said this to the Kosalan King Pasenadi: “Give upright!
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.6_0: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went to the Fortunate One,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.6_1: Now at that time a certain lay follower was sitting within the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.7_0: When the King saw him, he sat down to one side.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.8_0: But he considered, “This man isn’t likely to be bad, since he’s visiting the Buddha,”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.9_0: But that lay follower neither bowed down to the Buddha nor stood up for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.9_1: But King Pasenadi was displeased, “How can he bow down, and when we neither bowed down?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.10_0: Knowing this, the Buddha said to him, “Great king, this is a learned lay follower of King Pasenadi.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.11_0: But he considered, “This lay follower is worthy of an offering.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.12_0: The lay follower said this to him: “Please go.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.14_0: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.14_1: after which the Buddha got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.15_0: Just then King Pasenadi of Kosala was up in his best stilt house
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.15_1: King Pasenadi saw him walking along the street.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.16_0: He summoned him and said, “You are a learned Buddhist, a master of the tradition.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.17_0: It would be good if you would teach my harem.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.18_0: “Whatever I know, sir, I know because of the monks. They should teach the harem.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.1_0: Knowing that the lay follower was right, the King went to the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.1_2: and told him what was happening.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.2_0: “It would be good, Venerable Sir, if you would tell a monk to teach my harem.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.3_0: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.3_1: after which Jīvaka got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.4_0: Soon afterwards, the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda, “Well then, Ānanda, teach the King’s harem.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.6_0: Then, after robing up one the morning, Ānanda took his bowl and robe and went to King Pasenadi’s house.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.7_0: On that occasion the King was in bed with Queen Mallikā.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.8_0: Queen Mallikā saw Ānanda coming off in the distance
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.9_0: Ānanda turned around right there and returned to the monastery. And he told the monks what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.10_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.11_0: “How could Venerable Ānanda enter the royal compound without first being announced?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.12_0: “Is it true, Ānanda, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.15_0: “... Ānanda, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.16_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.18_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.1_0: “Mendicants, there are ten drawbacks to entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.3_0: It may be that a monk enters where the king is sitting with his queen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.4_0: The queen smiles when she sees the monk
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.5_0: or the monk smiles when he sees the queen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.7_0: ‘Surely they’ve done it, or they’re going to.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.8_0: This is the first drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.9_0: Again, because the king is very busy,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.10_0: he does not remember having slept with a certain woman,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.11_0: yet she becomes pregnant because of that.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.15_0: This is the second drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.16_0: Again, a gem disappears from the royal compound.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.20_0: This is the third drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.21_0: Again, secret discussions in the royal compound are spread outside.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.25_0: This is the fourth drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.26_0: Again, in the royal compound a father assails his son, or a son assails his father.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.30_0: This is the fifth drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.31_0: Furthermore, the king promotes someone to a higher position.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.33_0: ‘The king is close to the monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.35_0: This is the sixth drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.38_0: ‘The king is close to the monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.40_0: This is the seventh drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.41_0: Furthermore, the king dispatches the army at the wrong time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.43_0: ‘The king is close to the monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.45_0: This is the eighth drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.46_0: Again, after sending out the army at an appropriate time, the king orders it to turn back while still en route.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.48_0: ‘The king is close to the monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.50_0: This is the ninth drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.51_0: Furthermore, in the royal harem there is a trampling of elephants, horses, and chariots, as well as arousing sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and touches that do not befit a monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.52_0: This is the tenth drawback of entering a royal harem.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.53_0: Monks, these are the ten dangers in entering a royal compound.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.54_0: Then, after rebuking Ānanda in many ways for being difficult to support ... the Buddha said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.55_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.56.1_0: ‘If a monk, without first being announced, crosses the threshold to the bedroom of a consecrated aristocrat king, when both the king and the queen are present, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.6_0: well-born on both his mother’s side and his father’s side, pure in descent, irreproachable and impeccable with respect to birth going back seven generations of male ancestors.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.10_0: the king has not left the bedroom.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.12_0: the queen has not left the bedroom. Or both have not left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.16_0: the threshold to the bedroom is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.18_0: wherever a king’s bed is prepared, even if just enclosed by a cloth screen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.19_0: Crosses the threshold to the bedroom:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.20_0: If he crosses the threshold with the first foot, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.21_0: If he crosses the threshold with the second foot, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.1_0: If he has not been announced, and he does not perceive it as such, and he crosses the threshold to the bedroom, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.2_0: If he has not been announced, but he is unsure of it, and he crosses the threshold to the bedroom, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.3_0: If he has not been announced, and he perceives that he has, and he crosses the threshold to the bedroom, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.4_0: If there has been an announcement, but he does not perceive that there has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.5_0: If there has been an announcement, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.6_0: If he has been announced, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.3_0: if it is not an aristocrat king;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.5_0: if the king has left the bedroom;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.6_0: if the queen has left the bedroom;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.8_0: if it is not a bedroom;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.10_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.11_0: The first rule, the training rule on royal compounds, is finished.
